title: Drawing, 1755–60
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray washes, graphite on off-white laid paper
markings: Stamps: Verso (in black ink)- Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Boston.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: In the foreground a road leads to a three story building, which is drawn in graphitel. A carriage at center, small figures indicated around the building. Trees at right and left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1755–60.
1755–60. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray washes, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-487.
